intro: Cyphotheca hispida, commonly known as the hairy Cyphotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Cyphotheca hispida is well adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
